sentences.en: Clothing prices have not inflated as much as automobiles.
sentences.cn: 服装价格的涨幅不及汽车那么高。

sentences.en: Diabetics an insurer can expect to pay inflated premiums.
sentences.cn: 糖尿病患者投保可能需增加保险费.

sentences.en: Even his war record was fraudulently inflated.
sentences.cn: 甚至他的参战履历也是夸大其词，充满谎言。

sentences.en: George mended the type and then inflated it.
sentences.cn: 乔治先修好轮胎然后打了气.

sentences.en: He has a very inflated opinion of himself.
Inflated plastic film can protect any structure from the rain permanently or temporarily.
sentences.cn: 充气膨胀的塑料薄膜能永久或暂时地保护任何结构物不受雨水侵袭.

sentences.en: Microseconds later the universe inflated to become billions of miles wide.
sentences.cn: 一百万分之一秒之后,宇宙就膨胀到几十亿英里宽.

sentences.en: Monstrously inflated prices are designed to keep people like us at bay.
sentences.cn: 疯狂飞涨的价格会使像我们这样的人走投无路。

sentences.en: Stuart jumped into the sea and inflated the liferaft.
sentences.cn: 斯图尔特跳到海里给救生艇充气。

sentences.en: The prices of meals are often artificially inflated.
sentences.cn: 饭菜价格常常被人为地抬高.

sentences.en: There may be a mini - bubble in commodities, additionally inflated by Chinese hoarding.
sentences.cn: 大宗商品市场可能出现了小型泡沫, 而中国的囤货行为又进一步刺激了泡沫的膨胀.

sentences.en: They all seem to take an inflated view of their collective identity.
sentences.cn: 他们对自己的集体身份似乎都持有一种夸大的看法.

sentences.en: They had to buy everything at inflated prices at the ranch store.
sentences.cn: 他们不得不在农场商店以高价购买所有东西。

sentences.en: With a supply of compressed air, the large balloon inflated in a matter of seconds.
sentences.cn: 大气球注入压缩空气后, 几秒钟便膨胀了起来.

sentences.en: With a supply of compressed air,the large balloon inflated in a matter of seconds.
sentences.cn: 大气球注入压缩空气后，几秒钟便膨胀了起来。

words.tran_cn: 膨胀的，可充气的；得意的
通货膨胀的；通货膨胀倾向的；通货膨胀引起的
膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡
通货膨胀的；充了气的；价格飞涨的；（植物）肿胀的

trans.tran_cn: （价格）飞涨的，（通货）膨胀的，<贬>言过其实的，充了气的
trans.tran_en: inflated ideas, opinions etc about someone or something make them seem better, more important etc than they real-ly are

trans.tran_cn: 使充气（于轮胎、气球等）( inflate的过去式和过去分词 )，（使）膨胀，（使）通货膨胀，物价上涨
